sentences.en: Both the British and the Russians are trying to appear conciliatory.
sentences.cn: 英俄双方都试图显示和解的姿态.

sentences.en: Brooks felt in no mood to be conciliatory.
sentences.cn: 布鲁克斯不想作出和解。

sentences.en: Everyone was in a conciliatory mood at the start of the meeting.
sentences.cn: 会议开始时,人人都抱着和解的想法.

sentences.en: He drew the back of his hand across his nose with a conciliatory air.
sentences.cn: 他显出一副息事求和的样子,用手背抹了一下鼻子.

sentences.en: He turned round, sounding a little more conciliatory.
sentences.cn: 他回过脸来, 稍微和缓些.
她的脸色显得毫不调和.

sentences.en: His comments to reporters were conciliatory in tone.
sentences.cn: 他对记者们的讲话带着安抚的口吻。

sentences.en: His letter was couched in conciliatory terms.
sentences.cn: 他那封信里使用了表示和解的言辞.

sentences.en: Kraft , in turn , made conciliatory noises.
sentences.cn: 卡夫对此表示可以调解.

sentences.en: Mr Geoana, a former foreign minister, took a more conciliatory stance.
sentences.cn: 前外交部长吉瓦衲采取了更柔和的姿态.

sentences.en: Some conciliatory moves have already been made.
sentences.cn: 双方已经采取了一些调和的行动.

sentences.en: The meeting ended on a conciliatory and friendly note.
sentences.cn: 会晤以和解而友好的调子结束.

sentences.en: The next time he spoke he used a more conciliatory tone.
sentences.cn: 他再次开口时使用了更具安抚性的语气。

sentences.en: The politician struck a conciliatory tone with his former adversaries.
sentences.cn: 那个政客用安抚的口吻跟以前的对手说话.

sentences.en: The tone was neither aggressive nor conciliatory.
They approached the talks in a conciliatory spirit.
sentences.cn: 他们抱一种和解的态度去参加谈判。

words.tran_cn: 安抚，安慰；调和；驯服；怀柔；赢得

trans.tran_cn: 安抚的，说服的，调和的，调解的
trans.tran_en: doing something that is intended to make someone stop arguing with you
